result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerald Crawford Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: The first 5 days served straight time--the balance can be served with Huber for the Day Reproting Program--no objection to electronic monitoring while in the program

miscConds.notes: Pay costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant.
Maintain employment or be enrolled in school.
Court advises the defendant he cannot possess firearms

No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
No illegally controlled substances.

Must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored. 
Random screening.
Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substances, alcohol forfeits the release privileges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerald Crawford Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: No reply from surety or defendant.

Defendant Gerald Crawford in court with attorney Matthew A Lamke.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 8 months at the House of Correction - the first 5 days served straight time - the balance can be served with Huber for the Day Reporting Program - no objection to electronic monitoring while in the program - with 5 days credit.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years.

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) no illegally controlled substances; 4) random screening; 5) AODA,  treatment or program; 6) maintain employment or be enrolled in school. 

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, if not already done. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Gerald Crawford in court with attorney Matthew A Lamke.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court before sentencing.    There is a possibility of incarceration, if so, defendant should be prepared to start serving the sentence at the next date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds
State's Witness List, State's Requested Jury Instructions and Jury Instructions received and filed./d
Motions in Limine and Defendant's Proposed Alternative Language Selections, Additions and Deletions to the Standard Instruction for the Charged Offense received and filed./ds

Defendant Gerald Crawford in court with attorney Matthew A Lamke.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant appears in Court on a violation with a positive drug test for THC.  Court orders the bail forfeited and new cash bail set at $500 cash TOT to Justice Point with the same conditions.

Pretrial scheduling order received and filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Gerald Crawford in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

NO FILE IN COURT.   Defendant appears in court on a violation.  Defendant has tested positive for THC.  Defense does not challenge nor offer any excuse for the results.  Court sets bail at $100 cash TOT to Justice Point with the same conditions.

  Plea hearing scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gerald Crawford in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Paul Hauer for Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 2/28/14.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.    Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Gerald Crawford in court with attorney Matthew Lamke.  Defendant Gerald Crawford in custody.  Maureen A. Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. eam
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
